title: A 13-year-old died after being sucker-punched by a classmate
text:
A 13-year-old boy has died after being sucker-punched by a classmate at his California middle school, authorities announced this week.

The boy, identified by local media only as Diego, was punched at Landmark Middle School in Moreno Valley, California, on September 16, KTLA reported. Video of the incident filmed by a bystander caught national attention, as members of the community called for the officials to take action against violence in the school district.

Diego was hospitalized after the incident and died on Tuesday, Riverside County Sheriff's Department said in a Facebook post.

The sheriff's office said Diego was pronounced "clinically dead" as a result of injuries he sustained.

"Rigorous medical intervention and treatment efforts at an area hospital were unsuccessful. Preparations by Diego's family are underway for organ donation to transform this tragedy into the gift of life for other children," the post said.

Read more: A middle school student who was bullied for her Afro promised to return to school 'bigger and better' in an inspirational video

Two 13-year-old boys have been arrested in connection to the punch. The boys are being held on suspicion of assault, according to ABC 7. Their identities have not been made public.

Martinrex Kedziora, Moreno Valley Unified School District superintendent, said at a press conference on Wednesday that Deigo's death was an "immeasurable loss."

"On behalf of the Board of Education, I want to send my deepest condolences to the family and friends of our beloved student," Kedziora said.

Earlier on Wednesday, Kedziora told reporters that the school has increased its security measures since the incident, and that there is an ongoing investigation, according to ABC 7.
description: The boy, identified by local media only as Diego, was punched at Landmark Middle School in Moreno Valley, California, on September 16.
